sub_title: PhD Candidate - Department of Cardiologyü´Äat Amsterdam University Medical Center
summary:
Marijke Linschoten is a PhD candidate at the Amsterdam Heart Center located at Amsterdam University Medical Center (Amsterdam UMC). She has a bachelor in Biomedical Sciences and was thereafter trained as a clinician and clinical researcher during the 4-year master program Selective Utrecht Medical Master (SUMMA). Currently she is enrolled in the Postgraduate Epidemiology Master program at Utrecht University.

Her research focuses on the impact of cancer treatment on the cardiovascular system within the field of cardio-oncology. This is a new emerging discipline that aims to find a balance between the optimal oncologic efficacy and reducing adverse cardiovascular effects of anticancer treatment. Since the COVID-19 pandemic she expanded her research to unravel the interaction between COVID-19 and the cardiovascular system. 

Marijke Linschoten (co-) founded several consortia including ANTICIPATE (https://www.kwf.nl/onderzoek/onderzoeksdatabase/voorkomen-van-hartschade-door-anthracyclines-in-patienten-met), CAPACITY-COVID (https://capacity-covid.eu) and DEFENCE (https://projecten.zonmw.nl/nl/project/defence-determination-and-evaluation-frequency-and-effects-myocardial-damage-patients-sars).
